intro: Appendicula spathilabris, commonly known as the broad-leaved appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many species with showy, tubular flowers. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
